He also wrote a book that was significantly less laudatory of France.
Most recently, Badinter wrote a moving book about his grandmother, Idriss, who had immigrated to France in response to the pogroms in her native Bessarabia.
All of Badinter’s accomplishments have had a profound impact on France.
It is possible that he will ultimately be buried in the Pantheon in Paris, the mausoleum in which France’s greatest heroes are interred.
